channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Mazar says users' BTC reserves on Binance are fully collateralized
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The scope of the AUP was limited to users' BTC holdings on Binance.

item.title: Into the storm: The murky world of cryptocurrency mixers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: A handful of obfuscation protocols are competing for the user base of OFAC-sanctioned Tornado Cash.

item.title: Security in crypto comes from liquidity or the lessons we learned after FTX
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Hristina Yordanova
item.description: Following the FTX fiasco, retail and institutional investors alike are now looking to draw valuable conclusions.

item.title: Decentralized identity: Proving it’s really you in the 21st Century
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Singer

item.title: Was the fall of FTX really crypto’s ‘Lehman moment?’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Singer
item.description: Lehman Brothers’ 2008 collapse nearly brought the world financial system to its knees. Does FTX really compare? Are such analogies even useful?

item.title: Proactive sanctions can help spare the ecosystem: Chainalysis exec
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: Andrew Fierman highlighted the nuances of sanctions depending on who is involved, what is at stake and where they’re coming from.

item.title: Institutional investors still eye crypto despite the FTX collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Data sent by crypto exchange Bitstamp shows that institutional registrations in the trading platform increased by 57% in November.

item.title: Bank of Russia wants to ban miners from selling crypto to Russians
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The Russian central bank supports the idea of legalizing the crypto mining business, but only if miners sell their coins to non-residents of Russia.

item.title: BTC price hits new December low as Bitcoin dips 2% with Asia stocks
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin fails to hold $17,000 as BTC price correlation with Asia stocks stands out on the day.

item.title: Japan recommends against algorithmic backing in stablecoins
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The potential legal status of the Japanese Financial Service Agency’s recommendation is not clear as the current legislation is silent on algorithmic stablecoins.

item.title: Decentraland launches virtual property renting for LAND owners
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The metaverse platform announced that users who own LAND within Decentraland can officially rent out the rights to the space through the digital marketplace.

item.title: Report outlines reasons why stakeholders are against CBDC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The American Banking Banking Association highlighted that a CBDC issued by the U.S. Federal Reserve lacks “compelling use cases.”

item.title: US lawmakers want State Department to justify crypto rewards and disclose payouts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The State Department should submit a report on the use of cryptocurrencies as a viable reward payout with evidence that suggests it's more encouraging for whistleblowers.

item.title: Gate.io pledges $100M to revive crypto and rebuild investor confidence
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: With investors moving their funds away from exchanges into self-custody, market liquidity concerns are an immediate threat to struggling crypto businesses.

item.title: 3AC subpoenas issued as dispute grows over claims of Terraform dump
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: The bankruptcy judge has given approvals to subpoenas aimed at Three Arrows Capital’s leadership, while a new Terra Luna conspiracy has been floated.

item.title: Blockstream raises funds for mining at 70% lower company valuation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: CEO Adam Back said the fresh funding will be invested into expanding the firm’s mining capacity.

item.title: Nifty News: Winamp adds NFT support, Atari gets physical and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Atari has teamed up with Pixels.com for physical NFT artworks and Investopedia has given a rundown on NFT tax law.

item.title: Iran set to freeze bank accounts of women who refuse to wear a hijab
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Iran’s plan to freeze bank accounts reinforces the need for decentralized currencies to exist in tandem with cash and CBDCs.

item.title: Rep. Cawthorn fined for ethics breach over Let’s Go Brandon token promo
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The Ethics Committee couldn’t agree if the Representative sought to profit from his promotions, but he was fined for it regardless and for also not declaring a “gift” of the token.

item.title: Crypto will be regulated as securities — ICE boss and Senator Warren
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Senator Elizabeth Warren’s bill seeks to hand control to the SEC, imposing new obligations on centralized crypto firms, something Jeffrey Sprecher thinks will be good for crypto.

item.title: Nigeria bans ATM cash withdrawals over $225 a week to force use of CBDC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: The limits set by the Central Bank of Nigeria are part of a broader push to encourage digital financial transactions.

item.title: Fir Tree fund sues Grayscale in effort to force changes to Bitcoin Trust
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: The New York-based hedge funds want Grayscale to cough up information about its flagship Bitcoin trust which it believes could reveal potential mismanagement.

item.title: Fan tokens struggle to hold on as World Cup quarter-finals draw nearer
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Soccer fan tokens have seen their prices and trading volumes plummet since the start of the World Cup on Nov. 20.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried hires defense attorney as US authorities probe FTX: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Mark Cohen was a former assistant U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of New York who was also on the defense team for the high-profile criminal case involving Ghislaine Maxwell.

item.title: North Korean Lazarus Group is targeting crypto funds with a new spin on an old trick
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Microsoft and cybersecurity firm Volexity have traced a new version of AppleJeus malware to the hackers behind the Ronin exploit and numerous other online heists.

item.title: Cryptocurrency has become a playground for fraudsters
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Richard Cannon
item.description: Currency speculation was once the preserve of banking institutions, governments, and investment funds. But with cryptocurrency, it's being sold to the public as casino entertainment.

item.title: 3 reasons why Ethereum price keeps rejecting at the $1,300 level
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Traders are not sure if ETH will be able to hold the $1,200 level while the S&P 500 rapidly approaches the crucial 3,900 support and ETH derivatives data hints at more downside.

item.title: Paraguay's legislature fails to reverse presidential veto on crypto regulation law
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Just 38 out of 80 members of Paraguay’s Chamber of Deputies voted to reconsider a bill to cap electricity rates for the country’s crypto miners.

item.title: Warner Music, Polygon and LGND partner to launch Web3 music platform
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The platform LGND Music is set to officially launch in January 2023, and will also include dance record label Spinnin’ Records.

item.title: Bitcoin on-chain data shows 5 reasons why the BTC bottom could be in
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.category: when will the bear market end
is bitcoin price a good buy
is it time to buy bitcoin
item.description: On-chain analysis gives compelling reasons why BTC price could be in the final stages of a bottoming process.
